result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Edward Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Edward Wright is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Edward Wright was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 10 days time served.
Same conditions as probation, except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due and owed to be paid during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
If any cash bail remains after the mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges are paid, balance to be returned to remitter.
Maintain full time work as allowed by a Doctor or as allowed by medical restriction.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00.

Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Notify Department of Correction Agent of all prescriptions received by a Doctor within 72 hours of receiving. Defendant may only fill prescription at one pharmacy unless agent authorizes use of a different pharmacy and notifies agent of what pharmacy will be used.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. Court order drug and alcohol testing to occur at least 1 per month in the first year.
Defendant must attend at least 2 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
**08-24-15/ Carolina Stark**  
The Court ordered the JOC amended to reflect that the defendant shall serve the remaining balance of the condition time with release privileges for the Day Reporting Center (if eligible), work, inmate work assignments, alcohol and drug abuse treatment, and verified medical appointments.  The Court objects to Electronic Monitoring for the first 6 months of the defendant's condition time.  The Court does not object to Electronic Monitoring after the first 6 months of the defendant's condition time. 

Without good time credit, release for Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, Alcohol and Drug Assessment Treatment, and any verified medical appointments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring during the 1st six months, and no objection after 6 months with verified employment.

**06-19-15/ Carolina M Stark**
Based upon a report submitted to the Court, the privileges previously granted are cancelled, and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed.

Defendant Jason Edward Wright in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: David P.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 34 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 10 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 22 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. Court order drug and alcohol testing to occur at least 1 per month in     
  the first year.
- Defendant must attend at least 2 Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Maintain full time work  as allowed by a Doctor or as allowed by medical restriction.
- Notify Department of Correction Agent of all prescriptions received by a Doctor within 72 hours of receiving. Defendant may only fill prescription at one pharmacy unless agent authorizes use of a different pharmacy and notifies agent of what pharmacy will be used.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due and owed to be paid during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
If any cash bail remains after the mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges are paid, balance to be returned to remitter.
-Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction, without good time credit, release for Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, Alcohol and Drug Assessment Treatment, and any verified medical appointments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring during the 1st six months, and no objection after 6 months with verified employment.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

VIOLATION DATE WAS NOVEMBER 19, 2014.  Case not called on the record until this date.  Defendant had Justice Point Violation. Attorney Richard Sachs appears and advised the Court Defendant was admitted to the hospital but he does not have verification.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Jason Edward Wright in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs. Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Defense proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 2 - 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Note:  Court REITERATES that the defendant MAINTAIN Absolute Sobriety and NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
